wikipedia_page.main: Gareth Irfon Evans (born 18 April 1986) is a British weightlifter. He has competed in the 62 kg and 69 kg weight categories, and was selected to represent Great Britain at the 2012 Olympics.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 2012 Summer Olympics
Weightlifting at the 2010 Commonwealth Games – Men's 62 kg

response: He was named to the British team for the 2012 European Weightlifting Championships. He lifted a combined weight of , finishing in 21st position. He was a candidate for one of the three male weightlifting spots for the host country at the 2012 Olympics, having won the British Championship at the British Olympic trials in addition to achieving the B qualifying standard. However, he was not chosen for the British team, with Oliver, Peter Kirkbride and Gareth Evans chosen instead.

He competed in the men's 77 kg event at the 2014 Commonwealth Games where he won a bronze medal. The following day, he was arrested for breaking the nose of fellow Welsh competitor Gareth Evans and ordered to pay £400 after appearing at Glasgow Sheriff Court. He was later stripped of his Commonwealth Games accreditation and sent home in disgrace.
